At the end of this session, you should have accomplished the following:

1. You created a GitHub account.
1. You connected your GitHub account to your local Git using SSH.
1. You created a new *private(!)* GitHub repository.
1. You uploaded (i.e., "pushed") the default branch of your `{{< var course.project >}}` repository to GitHub.

**Collaboration Option 1:**

1. You invited a partner from the course as a collaborator to your `{{< var course.project >}}` on GitHub.
1. You collaborated on a shared project by adding and committing changes to your partner's repository.

**Collaboration Option 2:**

1. You clone your own repository to a different location on your computer.
1. Stage and commit changes in the repository in this new location.
1. Push the changes to GitHub and pull them in the original repository location on your computer.

### Optional:

1. You created a short `README.md` file in your repository.

Please keep the `{{< var course.project >}}` folder!
We will continue to use it in the following sessions.
